## Installation

```r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("IDMDataHub/gaitkit", subdir = "r")

# Optional but recommended: choose the Python interpreter explicitly
reticulate::use_python("/path/to/python", required = TRUE)

# Ensure the Python backend is installed in that interpreter
gaitkit::gk_install_python()
```

## Quick start

```r
library(gaitkit)

# Load a bundled example trial (healthy adult, overground walking)
trial <- gk_load_example("healthy")
cat(trial$description, "\n")

# Detect gait events with BIKE (default)
result <- gk_detect(trial)
print(result)
```

## Available methods

```r
gk_methods()
# "bike" "zeni" "oconnor" "hreljac" "mickelborough"
# "ghoussayni" "vancanneyt" "dgei" "intellevent" "deepevent"
```

## Ensemble detection

Combine multiple methods via temporal clustering and majority vote:

```r
result <- gk_detect_ensemble(
  trial,
  methods = c("bike", "zeni", "oconnor"),
  min_votes = 2
)
print(result)
```

## Visualisation

```r
# Timeline with HS/TO markers
plot(result)

# Gait cycle bar chart
plot(result, type = "cycles")
```

## Accessing results

```r
# Events data.frame
result$events

# Gait cycles
result$cycles

# Individual event lists
result$left_hs
result$right_to
```

## Example datasets

```r
gk_list_examples()
# "healthy" "parkinson" "kuopio" "stroke"

pd_trial <- gk_load_example("parkinson")
pd_result <- gk_detect(pd_trial, method = "bike")
summary(pd_result)
```
